Name: Hawk-Headed Dagger Handle of King Psusennes the First
Description: This hawk-headed dagger has a grip made of bronze and covered with gold leaf. The knob on the hilt takes the shape of a hawk head with vertical stripes chased in the metal. It also has a hooked beak and a sacred Udjat eye for protection with a highly emphasized eyebrow and a stylized tear. The inner part is engraved in imitation of the bird's feathers. The right edge of the handle is partially broken.
